sentences.sentence: Then a demon( 魔鬼 ) entered who was taller than all others.
He was old, however, and had a long white beard( 胡子 ).
“Say your prayers( 祷词 )!” said the demon.
“You shall soon learn what it is to be scared( 被惊吓 )—that is, if death scares( （使）害怕 ) you.”
“Not so fast,” replied the youth.
“If I am going to die, at least I will give you a good fight!”
“I will kill you right now!” said the demon.
“Do not talk so big. I am as strong as you are, and perhaps even stronger.”
“We shall see,” said the demon.
“If you are stronger, I will let you go—let us try.”
Then he led him by dark passages to a smith’s( 铁匠 ) forge( 锻造车间 ), took a big hammer( 锤子 ), and with one blow hammered( 敲击 ) an anvil( 铁砧 ) into the ground.
“I can do better than that,” said the youth, and went to the other anvil.
The demon placed himself near and wanted to look on, and his white beard hung down.
Then the youth took an ax( 斧头 ), split( （使）裂开 ) the anvil with one blow, and trapped( 夹住 ) the demon’s beard in with it.
“Now I have you,” said the youth.
“Now it is you who will have to die.”
Then he took an iron bar( 条状物 ) and beat the demon until he begged( 乞求 ) him to stop, and promised him great riches if he did.
The youth drew out the ax and let him go.
The demon led him back into the castle( 城堡 ), and in a cellar( 地下室 ) showed him three chests( 箱子 ) full of gold.
“Of these,” said he, “one is for the poor, the second is for the king, and the third is yours.”
Then it struck twelve, and the demon disappeared, leaving the youth in darkness.
“I shall still be able to find my way out,” he thought.
He felt about, found his way back, and slept by his fire.
Next morning the King came and said “Are you scared yet?”
“No,” he answered.
“What was supposed to be scary( 骇人的 )? My dead cousin was here, and a bearded( 有胡须的 ) man came and showed me a great deal of money down below, but no one showed me what it was to be scared.”
“Then,” said the King, “you have freed the castle.
You are obviously intelligent( 聪明的 ), brave, and capable( 能干的 ), and now you are also rich.
You shall marry my daughter, as I promised you.”
“That is all very well,” said he, “but still I do not know what it is to be scared.”
Then the gold was brought up, and the youth and the King’s daughter got married.
But even though the new Prince( 王子 ) loved his wife and was very happy with her, he was still always saying, “But what I want most is to learn to be scared.”
This upset( 使心烦意乱 ) the Princess( 公主 ), and finally she decided to do something about it.
So she ordered one of her servants to catch a whole bucket( 桶 ) full of fish from the stream( 小溪 ) outside the King’s palace.
Then at night when the new Prince was sleeping, his wife took his sleeping clothes off him and emptied the bucket of cold water with the fish in it over him.
The cold, wet, slimy( 黏糊糊的 ) fish were jumping and flapping( 拍打 ) all over him.
The new Prince woke up and said,
“Ugh( 哎呀 ), that was horrible( 糟糕的 )!
When I think that next time I go to sleep, you might pour( 倒 ) another bucket of fish over me, I get a very strange feeling that I’ve never felt before.
What is it?”
And his wife smiled at him and said, “I think that now you have learnt what it is to be scared.”

question.cn: 依魔鬼看，什么可以吓到男孩？
question.en: What could scare the boy in the demon’s opinion?

analysis: 文中提到：Then a demon entered who was taller than all others. He was old, however, and had a long white beard. “Say your prayers!” said the demon. “You shall soon learn what it is to be scared—that is, if death scares you.”，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 公主做了什么来使驸马害怕？
question.en: What did the Princess do to scare the Prince？

options.en: She made him eat raw fish.
She made him kill a fish.

analysis: 文中提到：“Then at night when the new Prince was sleeping, his wife took his sleeping clothes off him and emptied the bucket of cold water with the fish in it over him.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 驸马最终学会害怕了吗？
question.en: Did the Prince learn to be scared in the end?
